bcl:definition.bcl:text: professional engineer means a person who is registered under the Professional Governance Act as a professional engineer or professional engineering licensee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A refund under this section is not available for school taxes payable in the 2004 taxation year or any taxation year before 2004.

change.changenote: Section 6 (1) definition of "first exempt taxation year" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 288/2021, effective January 1, 2022.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: first exempt taxation year means, in relation to an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3, the first taxation year in which the power project's improvements are, on a final determination under the Assessment Act, exempt under section 4 as a result of the conditions set out in section 5 (1) being met.

change.changenote: Section 6 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 288/2021, effective January 1, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to this section, if on a final determination under the Assessment Act improvements of an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3 become exempt under section 4 as a result of the conditions set out in section 5 (1) being met, the minister of revenue may, on application by the taxpayer, refund to the taxpayer school taxes paid by the taxpayer before the first exempt taxation year.

change.changenote: Section 7 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 69/2017, effective March 1, 2017.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite anything in section 4 or 5 but subject to the conditions set out in subsections (2) and (3) of this section, the following improvements in respect of an eligible hydroelectric power project referred to in section 3 (1) (a) are exempt from school taxes for the 2005 taxation year:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: penstocks, penstock foundations and penstock support structures;

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An exemption under this section applies only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a professional engineer has certified that, as of October 31, 2004, the head pond storage capacity of the power project is no more than 24 hours of average annual flow,
the power project has, as of October 31, 2004, a contract with the authority to sell the authority power produced by the power project,
the term of the contract referred to in paragraph (b) is no less than 10 years from the date the contract was made, and
the owner or a senior executive officer of the power project confirms the facts described in paragraphs (b) and (c).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to the conditions and requirements set out in subsection (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a copy of a certificate under subsection (2) (a) must be provided

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: to the assessor of the assessment area in which the power project is located, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a confirmation under subsection (2) (d) must be

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: made to the assessor of the assessment area in which the power project is located, and

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The exemptions from school taxes provided under this section apply for the purposes of the 2005 taxation year and this regulation is retroactive to the extent necessary to apply for the purposes of that taxation year.
